title: NAFLD (Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease) Fibrosis Score
description: Estimates amount of scarring in the liver based on various lab tests. Distinguishes between patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease who have (F3-F4) and do not have (F0-F2) advanced fibrosis.

parameters.name: bmi
parameters.description: Body Mass Index calculated as weight(kg) / height(m)²

parameters.name: hyperglycemia
parameters.description: Presence of impaired fasting glucose (IFG) or diabetes mellitus

ranges.interpretation: Score < -1.455 is a predictor of absence of significant fibrosis (F0-F2 fibrosis). Negative predictive value of 93% for ruling out advanced fibrosis. These patients have mild to moderate fibrosis and are unlikely to have advanced liver disease.

Score between -1.455 and 0.676 falls in the indeterminate zone. Approximately 30% of patients fall into this range where the score cannot definitively rule in or rule out advanced fibrosis. Additional testing such as liver biopsy, elastography, or other non-invasive markers may be needed.

Score > 0.676 is a predictor of presence of significant fibrosis (F3-F4 fibrosis). Positive predictive value of 90% for advanced fibrosis. These patients likely have bridging fibrosis (F3) or cirrhosis (F4) and should be considered for close monitoring and treatment.

references: Angulo P, Hui JM, Marchesini G, Bugianesi E, George J, Farrell GC, et al. The NAFLD fibrosis score: a noninvasive system that identifies liver fibrosis in patients with NAFLD. Hepatology. 2007 Apr;45(4):846-54. doi: 10.1002/hep.21496.

McPherson S, Stewart SF, Henderson E, Burt AD, Day CP. Simple non-invasive fibrosis scoring systems can reliably exclude advanced fibrosis in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease. Gut. 2010 Sep;59(9):1265-9. doi: 10.1136/gut.2010.216077.
formula: NAFLD Score = -1.675 + 0.037 × age (years) + 0.094 × BMI (kg/m²) + 1.13 × hyperglycemia (yes=1, no=0) + 0.99 × AST/ALT ratio - 0.013 × platelet count (×10⁹/L) - 0.66 × albumin (g/dL)
notes: Fibrosis stages: F0 = absence of fibrosis, F1 = perisinusoidal or periportal fibrosis, F2 = perisinusoidal and portal/periportal fibrosis, F3 = bridging fibrosis, F4 = cirrhosis
The score was developed based on 733 patients with biopsy-proven NAFLD
AUROC for detecting advanced fibrosis was 0.88 (95% CI 0.85-0.92)
Approximately 30% of patients may fall into the indeterminate range requiring additional testing
The score helps reduce the need for liver biopsy by identifying patients likely or unlikely to have advanced fibrosis
